verificationTool.title: Verification Guide
verificationTool.description: How to independently verify events and receipts using open-source tools
verificationTool.introductionText1: This page guides you in independently verifying the fairness of results and the authenticity of your reply receipt using the provided data and open-source tools.
verificationTool.introductionText2: No trust in the platform is required, as all verification inputs and source code are publicly available.
verificationTool.step1Title: Go to the Reward Distribution Report to download the verification package (CSV).
verificationTool.step1_1: Go to the event page you want to verify.
verificationTool.step1_2: View the Reward Distribution Report for that event.
verificationTool.step1_3: Find the reward you want to verify and download the verification package.
verificationTool.step2Title: Set Up and Run the Event Verifier
verificationTool.step2_1_text_after: to inspect or download the verification script.
verificationTool.step2_2_text1: To run the verifier, you need to install the Go programming language (version 1.20 or above).
verificationTool.step2_2_text2: If you already have Go installed, you can skip this step.
verificationTool.step2_3_text: Download the open-source verifier code from GitHub and run it using Go.
verificationTool.codeBlockContentForCopy:
# Download the verifier
git clone https://github.com/koinvote/event-verifier.git
cd event-verifier

# Compile the verifier
go build -o verify-event main.go

# Run the verifier
# Replace <your-report-file.csv> with the actual report file you downloaded
./verify-event --report <your-report-file.csv>

verificationTool.faq1_question: What is the difference between event verification and receipt verification?
verificationTool.faq1_answer: Event verification ensures that the reward distribution for the entire event was fair, rule-based, and reproducible. Receipt verification confirms that your individual reply was properly recorded and cryptographically signed by the platform. These two mechanisms use different data sources and serve different purposes.
verificationTool.faq2_question: What happens if I forget to download my receipt?
verificationTool.faq2_answer: If you do not download your receipt after submitting your reply, you will not be able to independently verify your submission later. To preserve your right to verification, you should always download and securely store your receipt immediately after submission.
verificationTool.faq3_question: How can I be sure the public key used for verification is the correct one?
verificationTool.faq3_answer: The public key used for receipt verification is included in the open-source repository along with version information and its release date. You can verify its authenticity by checking the GitHub release page or commit history to ensure you are using the correct and officially published key version.

about.title: About Koinvote
about.introBold: Koinvote is a forum for Bitcoin holders, where opinions carry real and transparent influence according to their holdings.
about.intro: Through Koinvote, Bitcoin will evolve from an asset into a right. We believe that as Bitcoin adoption grows, this power will make an unparalleled contribution to human peace.
about.feature2: the Bitcoin related to your message signing never leaves your own address
about.feature3: all replies and holding information are publicly verifiable
about.feature4: earn potential returns by participating in events
about.outro: Through these features, we will provide a secure and effective platform to discover and deliver opinions from Bitcoin holders.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.scope_p1: This Privacy Policy describes how Koinvote collects, uses, discloses, and protects information when you access or use koinvote.com.
privacy.scope_p2: It does not apply to third-party websites or services that may be linked from the platform.
privacy.notice_p1: You may use koinvote.com without submitting any personal information, for example by using Tor or anti-chain-analysis services.
privacy.notice_p2: If you are concerned about your personal information being collected on this platform, it is your responsibility to take protective measures.
privacy.s1_1: <bold>User content</bold>: This includes event information created by users (such as titles, descriptions, or settings) and reply content submitted as part of participation. User content is publicly visible and forms part of the platform's audit records.
privacy.s1_2: <bold>Bitcoin address</bold>: Used to verify balances and determine voting weight.
privacy.s1_3: <bold>Digital signatures and plaintext</bold>: Used to verify actions and ensure authenticity.
privacy.s1_4: <bold>Email</bold>: Used as an <bold>unlock key</bold> to access certain event results, and may also be used for optional notifications.
privacy.s1_5: <bold>System logs</bold>: Such as IP addresses, device information, and report counts, used only for security, abuse prevention, and maintaining service stability. Logs are NOT used for behavioral profiling or cross-site tracking.
privacy.s2_1: To ensure transparency, all successfully submitted Bitcoin addresses, signatures, plaintexts, and reply content are publicly disclosed for audit purposes, except as explicitly stated below.
privacy.s2_2: For Creator-Only Visibility events, reply content is visible only to the event creator, while participation and payout records remain publicly available for verification purposes.
privacy.s2_3: For Paid-Only events, reply content may be restricted behind a paywall, but while participation and payout records may remain publicly accessible for audit purposes.
privacy.s2_4: Replies may be invalidated or reduced to zero weight before the event deadline by submitting a new signature or transferring funds to another address, but previously submitted signatures and records will not be deleted.
privacy.s2_5: Payout reports will disclose winning addresses, prize distribution amounts, and verification files for independent user validation.
privacy.s2_6: To preserve auditability and ensure the integrity of reward distribution, public submission records and payout-related data may be retained indefinitely. Such records consist only of information already made public as part of the platform's verification process.
privacy.s3_intro: Users' information may be shared under the following conditions:
privacy.s3_1_p1: We may share limited information with trusted third-party service providers who assist in operating the platform (such as hosting, infrastructure security, or email delivery).
privacy.s3_1_p2: These providers are only allowed to use the information as needed to perform services for Koinvote.
privacy.s3_1_p3: These service providers operate under their own privacy terms, which Koinvote does not control.
privacy.s3_2_p1: Information may be disclosed when required by applicable law, such as a valid court order.
privacy.s4_1: The platform does not and will never require access to your private keys.
privacy.s4_2: The system only retains information necessary to ensure fairness and security.
privacy.s4_3: While reasonable security measures are implemented, absolute security of data transmission and storage cannot be guaranteed.
privacy.s5_1: This policy may be updated from time to time and will be announced on the website.
privacy.s5_2: Continued use of the platform constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.s1_text: By using koinvote.com, you agree to comply with the following terms. If you do not agree, please stop using this platform.
terms.s2_p1: Koinvote is a Bitcoin-based forum where users can create time-limited events with or without prize pools.
terms.s2_p2: Users submit replies through Bitcoin addresses and verify participation via digital signatures.
terms.s2_p3: For rewarded events, after the event ends, prizes are drawn based on Bitcoin balance snapshots, and a public payout report is generated.
terms.s2_types_intro: The Platform offers two types of events:
terms.s2_type_1: <bold>Rewarded Events</bold> – Events with a prize pool funded by the creator.
terms.s2_type_2: <bold>Non-reward Events</bold> – Events without a prize pool, but still require signature verification.
terms.s2_visibility_intro: For <bold>Rewarded Events</bold>, the event creator may configure the <bold>result visibility</bold> after the event concludes.
terms.s2_visibility_intro2: In such cases, the creator may choose one of the following visibility settings:
terms.s2_visibility_1: <bold>Paid-Only Visibility</bold> – Event results are accessible only to users who complete payment and obtain a valid unlock code.
terms.s2_visibility_2: <bold>Creator-Only Visibility</bold> – Event results are accessible only to the event creator and are not made publicly available.
terms.s2_paid_p1: For events configured as <bold>Paid-Only Visibility</bold>, users must complete payment in order to obtain an <bold>unlock code</bold> required to access the event results.
terms.s2_paid_p2: Such payment grants <bold>personal, non-transferable reading access only</bold> and does not convey any ownership or redistribution rights.
terms.s2_paid_p3: Users are strictly prohibited from <bold>reselling, transferring, sharing, or publicly disclosing</bold> the unlock code, as well as from redistributing or publishing any event results or related data.
terms.s2_paid_p4: If a violation is detected, the platform reserves the right to <bold>invalidate the unlock code</bold> without notice or compensation.
terms.s2_paid_p5: The unlock code is provided <bold>for a single opportunity to download or save only</bold> after payment is completed.
terms.s2_paid_p6: If the user leaves the page without saving the unlock code, or if the unlock code is lost for any reason, the platform <bold>will not reissue or recover the code</bold>.
terms.s2_creator_p1: For events configured as <bold>Creator-Only Visibility</bold>, the event results, reply content, digital signatures, and participation records are visible <bold>only to the event creator</bold> and are not publicly displayed.
terms.s2_creator_p2: Participants acknowledge and agree that, for such events, <bold>result visibility, interpretation, and any subsequent use of the results are solely determined by the event creator</bold>, and the platform does not guarantee public disclosure of such results.
terms.s3_text: The Bitcoin you use must not originate from illegal sources, nor may it be involved in money laundering or other unlawful activities. When participating in replies, you must hold a Bitcoin address with a balance greater than zero.
terms.s4_p1: If the creator sets an event duration exceeding the free-hours allowance, the creator must pay the additional fee.
terms.s4_p2: Payment and refund rules follow the policies described in Charges & Refunds.
terms.s5_1: Reward draws are conducted based on Bitcoin balance snapshots, with the snapshot block height defined as the first block generated after the event deadline.
terms.s5_2: The winning probability of each address is determined by its Bitcoin holdings at the time of the snapshot.
terms.s5_3: Reward calculations, winner selection, and payout results are determined solely according to the platform's snapshot and internal processes, and the platform reserves the right to resolve discrepancies at its discretion.
terms.s5_4: After deducting <a1>service fees</a1> and <a2>transaction fees</a2>, the remaining reward pool will be distributed proportionally to the winning addresses based on their holdings.
terms.s5_5: Each reward is drawn independently. The same address cannot win more than once within the same reward draw but may win multiple times across different prizes.
terms.s5_6: If the payout amount for a winning address is below the minimum payout threshold (Dust Rule), the reward will be redistributed.
terms.s6_p1: Certain events may enable a Preheat period before they officially open.
terms.s6_p2: Creators who enable Preheat may be required to pay additional fees based on the duration of the Preheat period.
terms.s6_p3: All Preheat-related fees and rules are governed by the platform's Charges & Refunds policy.
terms.s7_1: You must ensure that the Bitcoin address you provide is accurate.
terms.s7_2: You agree not to use this platform for any illegal or disruptive activities, including but not limited to money laundering, fraud, abuse of reporting, or system attacks.
terms.s7_3: You must not distribute personal data, hate speech, or any other unlawful, inappropriate, or rights-infringing content through this platform.
terms.s7_4: You are solely responsible for all content you submit or create on the platform. The platform does not endorse, verify, or assume liability for user-generated content.

These limits may be adjusted at any time based on platform needs, system load, or abuse prevention requirements.

charges.title: Charges and Refunds
charges.s1_1_1_text: A platform service fee of <bold>{{platformFeePercentage}}%</bold> will be deducted from each event reward pool.
charges.s1_1_2_text: All no-reward events include <bold>{{freeHours}} hours of free duration</bold>. For any additional time beyond {{freeHours}} hours, the platform will charge <bold>{{btcPerDurationHour}} BTC per hour</bold>.
charges.s1_2_text: All reward distribution and refund transactions are subject to Bitcoin network fees, based on the recommended fee rate at the time of processing.
charges.s1_3_text1: For events with Preheat enabled, the preheat cost is calculated as:
charges.s1_3_text2: <bold>Preheat Fee = (No-reward event hourly rate) x (0.2 + 0.8 x Preheat Hours / 720)</bold>
charges.s1_4_text1: All payments on the platform follow a <bold>precision payment model</bold>.
charges.s1_4_text2: Users must submit the <bold>exact amount specified</bold> by the platform within the allowed time window.
charges.s1_4_text3: Payments with incorrect amounts <bold>do not guarantee event activation, result unlocking, or refunds</bold>, regardless of whether the amount is higher or lower than required.
charges.s2_1_text: Refunds are <bold>not provided</bold> under the following circumstances:
charges.s2_1_1_text: Any payment made with an incorrect amount, including underpayments or overpayments.
charges.s2_1_2_text: Payment transactions that generate <bold>multiple outputs within the same transaction</bold>.
charges.s2_1_3_text1: Payments sent directly to a creator's address, including but not limited to payments for unlocking <bold>paid-only event results</bold>.
charges.s2_1_3_text2: Such payments are considered <bold>final and irreversible</bold>.
charges.s2_2_title: Event Refund Due to No Participation
charges.s2_2_text: If a reward event receives <bold>no valid replies</bold> by the event deadline, the event creator may apply for a refund of the <bold>remaining reward pool</bold>. Approval of such refunds is subject to platform verification and processing.
charges.s2_3_text1: All approved refunds are subject to Bitcoin network transaction fees.
charges.s2_3_text2: If the refundable amount is insufficient to cover these fees, <bold>no refund will be issued</bold>.

rewardTerms.title: Terms of Reward Distribution
rewardTerms.intro: This document defines the rules and mechanisms of reward distribution, which are based on a weighted selection process using Bitcoin holdings.
rewardTerms.s1_1: The snapshot is taken at the first block generated after the event deadline, with 1 confirmation required.
rewardTerms.s1_2: Only confirmed UTXOs are counted; unconfirmed transactions are excluded.
rewardTerms.s2_1: The participating address must hold a non-zero balance, and the funds must not originate from illegal activities.
rewardTerms.s2_2: Eligibility is based on the latest valid signature of the address within the platform.
rewardTerms.s2_3: If a new signature is detected within same event before the event deadline, the previous one automatically becomes invalid.
rewardTerms.s3_1: Random draws are conducted using holdings as weights.
rewardTerms.s3_2: Each reward pool is drawn independently.
rewardTerms.s3_3: The same address can win only once per reward pool, but may win again in different reward pools.
rewardTerms.s4_0: Before distribution, the total reward pool will have fees deducted from it:
rewardTerms.s4_1: The net distributable reward pool, after fees are deducted from the total, is allocated proportionally to winners based on their holdings.
rewardTerms.s5_1: The platform sets a <bold>minimum payout threshold of {{dustThresholdSat}} sats.</bold> If a winner's reward is below this amount, it will not be distributed directly but added to the redistribution pool.
rewardTerms.s6_1: <bold>Dust amounts</bold> will be redistributed according to winners' holdings.
rewardTerms.s6_2: If a remainder is generated during rounding, it will be assigned to the address with the largest holdings.
rewardTerms.s7_1: If the number of participants is fewer than the number of winners, all participants win.
rewardTerms.s7_2: If there are no valid replies, the remaining balance after applicable deductions <bold>may be refunded</bold> to the refund address.
rewardTerms.examplesIntro: The following examples are provided for illustrative purposes only and do not represent guaranteed outcomes.
rewardTerms.ex1_selection_1: Round 1: A (80%), B (15%), C (5%) → assume A wins
rewardTerms.ex1_selection_2: Round 2 (A removed): B (75%), C (25%) → assume B wins
rewardTerms.ex1_distribution_1: Net distributable reward = Total reward - Platform fee - Transaction fee

rewardTerms.ex2_step1_c: C = <bold>472</bold> sats → below the 10,000-sat threshold, treated as Dust
rewardTerms.ex2_step2_label: Redistribute Dust 514 sats (proportional to holdings, rounded down; remainder handled in Step 3):
rewardTerms.ex2_step3_1: 2 sat from Dust + 1 sat from Step 1 → total 3 sats
